story: Abdelrahman Omran shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Does MariaDB supports JSON column data type?
caption: dba.stackexchange.com
description: Does MariaDB supports JSON column data type? I’m not talking about dynamic columns, I’m asking about native column JSON data type. In simple words, can I run the following code on any MariaDB versi...

data.message:
-- Update --
Just found three issues still open on MariaDB Jira about JSON data type support, which means it's still not yet implemented, right?

- https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-9056
- https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-9144
- https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-6632

I haven't used MariaDB before, but maybe it supports JSON queries without having a JSON column type, this is what SQL Server does. In SQL Server json columns are regular nvarchar and you just use json functions on the columns to get properties and values.

As far as i know , its not available in the stable version.
But if you want JSON dataType , Use document based NoSQL db :P :P
